member.name: T:Avalonia.Controls.Classes
member.summary: Holds a collection of style classes for an .
member.remarks: Similar to CSS, each control may have any number of styling classes applied.

member.name: M:Avalonia.Controls.Classes.#ctor
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

member.name: M:Avalonia.Controls.Classes.#ctor(System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{System.String})
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

member.name: M:Avalonia.Controls.Classes.#ctor(System.String[])
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

member.name: M:Avalonia.Controls.Classes.Parse(System.String)
member.summary: Parses a classes string.

member.name: M:Avalonia.Controls.Classes.Add(System.String)
member.summary: Adds a style class to the collection.
member.remarks: Only standard classes may be added via this method. To add pseudoclasses (classes beginning with a ':' character) use the protected property.

member.name: M:Avalonia.Controls.Classes.AddRange(System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{System.String})
member.summary: Adds a style classes to the collection.
member.remarks: Only standard classes may be added via this method. To add pseudoclasses (classes beginning with a ':' character) use the protected property.

member.name: M:Avalonia.Controls.Classes.Clear
member.summary: Removes all non-pseudoclasses from the collection.

member.name: M:Avalonia.Controls.Classes.Insert(System.Int32,System.String)
member.summary: Inserts a style class into the collection.
member.param: The index to insert the class at.
member.remarks: Only standard classes may be added via this method. To add pseudoclasses (classes beginning with a ':' character) use the protected property.

member.name: M:Avalonia.Controls.Classes.InsertRange(System.Int32,System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{System.String})
member.summary: Inserts style classes into the collection.
member.param: The index to insert the class at.
member.remarks: Only standard classes may be added via this method. To add pseudoclasses (classes beginning with a ':' character) use the protected property.

member.name: M:Avalonia.Controls.Classes.Remove(System.String)
member.summary: Removes a style class from the collection.
member.remarks: Only standard classes may be removed via this method. To remove pseudoclasses (classes beginning with a ':' character) use the protected property.

member.name: M:Avalonia.Controls.Classes.RemoveAll(System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{System.String})
member.summary: Removes style classes from the collection.
member.remarks: Only standard classes may be removed via this method. To remove pseudoclasses (classes beginning with a ':' character) use the protected property.

member.name: M:Avalonia.Controls.Classes.RemoveAt(System.Int32)
member.summary: Removes a style class from the collection.
member.param: The index of the class in the collection.
member.remarks: Only standard classes may be removed via this method. To remove pseudoclasses (classes beginning with a ':' character) use the protected property.

member.name: M:Avalonia.Controls.Classes.RemoveRange(System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Removes style classes from the collection.
member.param: The number of items to remove.

member.name: M:Avalonia.Controls.Classes.Replace(System.Collections.Generic.IList{System.String})
member.summary: Removes all non-pseudoclasses in the collection and adds a new set.
member.param: The new contents of the collection.

member.name: M:Avalonia.Controls.Classes.Set(System.String,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Adds a or removes a style class to/from the collection.
member.param: If true adds the class, if false, removes it.
member.remarks: Only standard classes may be added or removed via this method. To add pseudoclasses (classes beginning with a ':' character) use the protected property.

member.name: T:Avalonia.Controls.INameScope
member.summary: Defines a name scope.

member.name: M:Avalonia.Controls.INameScope.Register(System.String,System.Object)
member.summary: Registers an element in the name scope.

member.name: M:Avalonia.Controls.INameScope.FindAsync(System.String)
member.summary: Finds a named element in the name scope, waits for the scope to be completely populated before returning null Returned task is configured to run any continuations synchronously.
member.returns: The element, or null if the name was not found.

member.name: M:Avalonia.Controls.INameScope.Find(System.String)
member.summary: Finds a named element in the name scope, returns immediately, doesn't traverse the name scope stack
member.returns: The element, or null if the name was not found.

member.name: M:Avalonia.Controls.INameScope.Complete
member.summary: Marks the name scope as completed, no further registrations will be allowed

member.name: P:Avalonia.Controls.INameScope.IsCompleted
member.summary: Returns whether further registrations are allowed on the scope

member.summary: Exposes an interface for setting pseudoclasses on a collection.

member.summary: Adds a pseudoclass to the collection.

member.name: M:Avalonia.Controls.IPseudoClasses.Remove(System.String)

member.summary: An indexed dictionary of resources.

member.name: P:Avalonia.Controls.IResourceDictionary.MergedDictionaries
member.summary: Gets a collection of child resource dictionaries.

member.name: T:Avalonia.Controls.IResourceHost
member.summary: Represents an element which hosts resources.
member.remarks: This interface is implemented by and `Application`.

member.name: E:Avalonia.Controls.IResourceHost.ResourcesChanged
member.summary: Raised when the resources change on the element or an ancestor of the element.

member.name: M:Avalonia.Controls.IResourceHost.NotifyHostedResourcesChanged(Avalonia.Controls.ResourcesChangedEventArgs)
member.summary: Notifies the resource host that one or more of its hosted resources has changed.
member.remarks: This method will be called automatically by the framework, you should not need to call this method yourself. It is called when the resources hosted by this element have changed, and is usually called by a resource dictionary or style hosted by the element in response to a resource being added or removed.

member.name: T:Avalonia.Controls.IResourceNode
member.summary: Represents an object that can be queried for resources.
member.remarks: The interface represents a common interface for both controls that host resources () and resource providers such as (see ).

member.name: P:Avalonia.Controls.IResourceNode.HasResources
member.summary: Gets a value indicating whether the object has resources.

member.name: M:Avalonia.Controls.IResourceNode.TryGetResource(System.Object,System.Object@)
member.summary: Tries to find a resource within the object.
member.param: When this method returns, contains the value associated with the specified key, if the key is found; otherwise, null.
member.returns: True if the resource if found, otherwise false.

member.name: T:Avalonia.Controls.IResourceProvider
member.summary: Represents an object that can be queried for resources but does not appear in the logical tree.
member.remarks: This interface is implemented by , and

member.name: P:Avalonia.Controls.IResourceProvider.Owner
member.summary: Gets the owner of the resource provider.
member.remarks: If multiple owners are added, returns the first.

member.name: E:Avalonia.Controls.IResourceProvider.OwnerChanged
member.summary: Raised when the of the resource provider changes.

member.summary: Adds an owner to the resource provider.

member.name: M:Avalonia.Controls.IResourceProvider.RemoveOwner(Avalonia.Controls.IResourceHost)
member.summary: Removes a resource provider owner.

member.name: T:Avalonia.Controls.ISetInheritanceParent
member.summary: Defines an interface through which a 's inheritance parent can be set.
member.remarks: You should not usually need to use this interface - it is for advanced scenarios only. Additionally, also sets the inheritance parent; this interface is only needed where the logical and inheritance parents differ.

member.name: M:Avalonia.Controls.ISetInheritanceParent.SetParent(Avalonia.IAvaloniaObject)
member.summary: Sets the control's inheritance parent.

member.name: T:Avalonia.Controls.ISetLogicalParent
member.summary: Defines an interface through which a 's logical parent can be set.
member.remarks: You should not usually need to use this interface - it is for advanced scenarios only.

member.summary: Sets the control's parent.

member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

member.summary: Gets the list of pseudoclass names.

member.name: T:Avalonia.Controls.Metadata.TemplatePartAttribute
member.summary: Defines a control template part referenced by name in code. Template part names should begin with the "PART_" prefix.
member.remarks: Style authors should be able to identify the part type used for styling the specific control. The part is usually required in the style and should have a specific predefined name.

member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.
member.param: The part name used by the class to identify a required element in the style.
The type of the element that should be used as a part with name.

member.name: P:Avalonia.Controls.Metadata.TemplatePartAttribute.Name
member.summary: Gets or sets the part name used by the class to identify a required element in the style. Template part names should begin with the "PART_" prefix.

member.name: P:Avalonia.Controls.Metadata.TemplatePartAttribute.Type
member.summary: Gets or sets the type of the element that should be used as a part with name specified in .

member.name: T:Avalonia.LogicalTree.LogicalTreeAttachmentEventArgs
member.summary: Holds the event arguments for the and events.

member.name: M:Avalonia.LogicalTree.LogicalTreeAttachmentEventArgs.#ctor(Avalonia.LogicalTree.ILogicalRoot,Avalonia.LogicalTree.ILogical,Avalonia.LogicalTree.ILogical)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.
member.param: The root of the logical tree.

member.name: P:Avalonia.LogicalTree.LogicalTreeAttachmentEventArgs.Root
member.summary: Gets the root of the logical tree that the control is being attached to or detached from.

member.name: P:Avalonia.LogicalTree.LogicalTreeAttachmentEventArgs.Source
member.summary: Gets the control that was attached or detached from the logical tree.
member.remarks: Logical tree attachment events travel down the attached logical tree from the point of attachment/detachment, so this control may be different from the control that the event is being raised on.

member.name: P:Avalonia.LogicalTree.LogicalTreeAttachmentEventArgs.Parent
member.summary: Gets the control that is being attached to or detached from.
member.remarks: For logical tree attachment, holds the new logical parent of . For detachment, holds the old logical parent of . If the detachment event was caused by a top-level control being closed, then this property will be null.

member.name: T:Avalonia.StyledElement
member.summary:
Extends an with the following features:
- An inherited . - Implements to allow styling to work on the styled element. - Implements to form part of a logical tree. - A collection of class strings for custom styling.

member.name: F:Avalonia.StyledElement.DataContextProperty
member.summary: Defines the property.

member.name: F:Avalonia.StyledElement.NameProperty
member.summary: Defines the property.

member.name: F:Avalonia.StyledElement.ParentProperty
member.summary: Defines the property.

member.name: F:Avalonia.StyledElement.TemplatedParentProperty
member.summary: Defines the property.

member.name: M:Avalonia.StyledElement.#cctor
member.summary: Initializes static members of the class.

member.name: M:Avalonia.StyledElement.#ctor
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

member.name: E:Avalonia.StyledElement.AttachedToLogicalTree
member.summary: Raised when the styled element is attached to a rooted logical tree.

member.name: E:Avalonia.StyledElement.DetachedFromLogicalTree
member.summary: Raised when the styled element is detached from a rooted logical tree.

member.name: E:Avalonia.StyledElement.DataContextChanged
member.summary: Occurs when the property changes.
member.remarks: This event will be raised when the property has changed and all subscribers to that change have been notified.

member.name: E:Avalonia.StyledElement.Initialized
member.summary: Occurs when the styled element has finished initialization.
member.remarks: The Initialized event indicates that all property values on the styled element have been set. When loading the styled element from markup, it occurs when is called *and* the styled element is attached to a rooted logical tree. When the styled element is created by code and is not used, it is called when the styled element is attached to the visual tree.

member.name: E:Avalonia.StyledElement.ResourcesChanged
member.summary: Occurs when a resource in this styled element or a parent styled element has changed.

member.name: P:Avalonia.StyledElement.Name
member.summary: Gets or sets the name of the styled element.
member.remarks: An element's name is used to uniquely identify an element within the element's name scope. Once the element is added to a logical tree, its name cannot be changed.

member.name: P:Avalonia.StyledElement.Classes
member.summary: Gets or sets the styled element's classes.

remarks.para: Classes can be used to apply user-defined styling to styled elements, or to allow styled elements that share a common purpose to be easily selected.

Even though this property can be set, the setter is only intended for use in object initializers. Assigning to this property does not change the underlying collection, it simply clears the existing collection and adds the contents of the assigned collection.

member.name: P:Avalonia.StyledElement.DataContext
member.summary: Gets or sets the control's data context.
member.remarks: The data context is an inherited property that specifies the default object that will be used for data binding.

member.name: P:Avalonia.StyledElement.IsInitialized
member.summary: Gets a value that indicates whether the element has finished initialization.
member.remarks: For more information about when IsInitialized is set, see the event.

member.name: P:Avalonia.StyledElement.Styles
member.summary: Gets the styles for the styled element.
member.remarks: Styles for the entire application are added to the Application.Styles collection, but each styled element may in addition define its own styles which are applied to the styled element itself and its children.

member.name: P:Avalonia.StyledElement.Resources
member.summary: Gets or sets the styled element's resource dictionary.

member.name: P:Avalonia.StyledElement.TemplatedParent
member.summary: Gets the styled element whose lookless template this styled element is part of.

member.name: P:Avalonia.StyledElement.LogicalChildren
member.summary: Gets the styled element's logical children.

member.name: P:Avalonia.StyledElement.PseudoClasses
member.summary: Gets the collection in a form that allows adding and removing pseudoclasses.

member.name: P:Avalonia.StyledElement.Avalonia#LogicalTree#ILogical#IsAttachedToLogicalTree
member.summary: Gets a value indicating whether the element is attached to a rooted logical tree.

member.name: P:Avalonia.StyledElement.Parent
member.summary: Gets the styled element's logical parent.

member.name: P:Avalonia.StyledElement.Avalonia#LogicalTree#ILogical#LogicalParent
member.summary: Gets the styled element's logical parent.

member.name: P:Avalonia.StyledElement.Avalonia#LogicalTree#ILogical#LogicalChildren
member.summary: Gets the styled element's logical children.

member.name: P:Avalonia.StyledElement.Avalonia#Styling#IStyleable#StyleKey
member.summary: Gets the type by which the styled element is styled.
member.remarks: Usually controls are styled by their own type, but there are instances where you want a styled element to be styled by its base type, e.g. creating SpecialButton that derives from Button and adds extra functionality but is still styled as a regular Button.

member.name: M:Avalonia.StyledElement.ApplyStyling
member.summary: Applies styling to the control if the control is initialized and styling is not already applied.
member.returns: A value indicating whether styling is now applied to the control.

member.name: M:Avalonia.StyledElement.InvalidateStyles
member.summary: Detaches all styles from the element and queues a restyle.

member.summary: Sets the styled element's inheritance parent.

member.summary: An aggregate which is active when all of its inputs are active.

member.name: T:Avalonia.Styling.Activators.AndActivatorBuilder
member.summary: Builds an .
member.remarks: When ANDing style activators, if there is more than one input then creates an instance of . If there is only one input, returns the input directly.

member.name: T:Avalonia.Styling.Activators.IStyleActivator
member.summary: Defines a style activator.
member.remarks:
A style activator is very similar to an `IObservable{bool}` but is optimized for the particular use-case of activating a style according to a selector. It differs from an observable in two major ways:
- Can only have a single subscription - The subscription can have a tag associated with it, allowing a subscriber to index into a list of subscriptions without having to allocate additional objects.

member.name: M:Avalonia.Styling.Activators.IStyleActivator.Subscribe(Avalonia.Styling.Activators.IStyleActivatorSink,System.Int32)
member.summary: Subscribes to the activator.

member.name: M:Avalonia.Styling.Activators.IStyleActivator.Unsubscribe(Avalonia.Styling.Activators.IStyleActivatorSink)
member.summary: Unsubscribes from the activator.

member.summary: Receives notifications from an .

member.name: M:Avalonia.Styling.Activators.IStyleActivatorSink.OnNext(System.Boolean,System.Int32)
member.summary: Called when the subscribed activator value changes.

member.summary: Represents a setter that has been instanced on a control.

member.name: M:Avalonia.Styling.ISetterInstance.Start(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Starts the setter instance.
member.param: Whether the parent style has an activator.
member.remarks: If is false then the setter should be immediately applied and and should not be called. If true, then bindings etc should be initiated but not produce a value until called.

member.name: M:Avalonia.Styling.ISetterInstance.Activate
member.summary: Activates the setter.
member.remarks: Should only be called if hasActivator was true when was called.

member.name: M:Avalonia.Styling.ISetterInstance.Deactivate
member.summary: Deactivates the setter.
member.remarks: Should only be called if hasActivator was true when was called.
